additionalProperty.name: Customizable Reports
additionalProperty.value: Customizable reports in telematics allow users to tailor data analysis to their specific needs, offering insights beyond standard reports. These reports can be created based on various criteria like vehicle, trip, or driver and can include detailed information on fuel usage, driving behavior and more. This flexibility enables businesses to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs), track trends and make data-driven decisions for improved efficiency and safety.

additionalProperty.name: Customer Geofencing
additionalProperty.value: Geofencing, when integrated with telematics, allows businesses to create virtual boundaries around specific locations using GPS technology. When a vehicle equipped with telematics crosses these boundaries (enters or exits), automated actions or alerts are triggered. This technology enhances fleet management by providing real-time location updates, improving route compliance, optimizing delivery times and boosting customer service.

additionalProperty.name: Driver's behavior monitoring
additionalProperty.value: A driver behavior monitoring system is a technology-driven solution that continuously tracks and analyzes how drivers operate their vehicles. By using vehicle telematics, GPS and various in-vehicle sensors, the system collects data on driving actions - speed, acceleration, braking and cornering - to provide real-time insights into driver performance.

additionalProperty.name: Roadside assistance
additionalProperty.value: Telematics systems in vehicles can include a roadside assistance feature, allowing drivers to request help directly through the system in case of a breakdown or other emergencies. This feature often involves contacting roadside assistance providers and can also include automatic emergency response and collision detection.

additionalProperty.name: Security services
additionalProperty.value: Security services in telematics provide protection through multiple layers including theft prevention with real-time tracking and tamper alerts, unauthorized use detection via geofencing and after-hours monitoring, rapid stolen vehicle recovery, driver protection through dashcam evidence for false claim exoneration, cybersecurity measures with data encryption and authentication, system redundancy for critical safety functions, continuous monitoring and diagnostics.

additionalProperty.name: Stolen vehicle recovery
additionalProperty.value: Telematics plays a crucial role in stolen vehicle recovery by providing real-time location tracking and remote control capabilities. When a vehicle is stolen, telematics systems can pinpoint its exact location, enabling swift recovery by law enforcement. These systems also offer features like remote engine shutdown and geofencing, further aiding in the recovery process and acting as a deterrent to theft.

additionalProperty.name: Trip KPI dashboard
additionalProperty.value: A Trip KPI (Key Performance Indicator) dashboard, integrated with telematics, provides a comprehensive overview of vehicle trip data, enabling fleet managers to track and analyze key performance indicators for efficient fleet management. This dashboard offers insights into various aspects of each trip, such as fuel consumption, distance traveled, driving time, idling time and more, allowing for data-driven decision-making.

additionalProperty.name: GPS Tracking
additionalProperty.value: Telematics incorporates GPS tracking as a core component, enabling the monitoring of vehicle location and movement. Telematics systems use GPS data, along with other information from the vehicle's on-board diagnostics, to provide a comprehensive view of vehicle performance and driver behavior. This data is transmitted to a central system where it can be analyzed and used for fleet management, improving efficiency and enhancing safety.

additionalProperty.name: Maintenance Schedules
additionalProperty.value: Telematics enhances fleet maintenance by providing data-driven insights for scheduling and optimizing maintenance activities. By tracking vehicle data like mileage, engine hours and fuel consumption, telematics allows for more precise and proactive maintenance, leading to reduced downtime, improved efficiency and lower costs.

additionalProperty.name: Vehicle Engine Diagnostics Codes
additionalProperty.value: Telematics systems can integrate with Vehicle Engine Diagnostic Codes, also known as Diagnostic Trouble Codes (DTCs). These systems monitor various vehicle components and systems and when a fault is detected, they can relay the corresponding DTCs to a central platform. This allows for remote diagnostics, proactive maintenance and potentially reduced downtime.

additionalProperty.name: Diagnostic Error Code Alerts
additionalProperty.value: Diagnostic trouble codes (DTCs) are alerts generated by a vehicle's onboard diagnostics (OBD) system to indicate malfunctions. Telematics, which combines telecommunications and informatics, can read and interpret these DTCs in real-time, providing immediate alerts to fleet managers and maintenance personnel. This integration allows for proactive maintenance, reduced downtime and optimized fleet management.

additionalProperty.name: Tachograph, odometer reading
additionalProperty.value: Tachographs, primarily used to record driving time and distance for compliance with regulations, can be integrated with telematics systems to provide additional data and functionality, including odometer readings. This integration allows for remote access to tachograph data, including odometer readings, alongside other telematics data like vehicle location, driver behavior and engine diagnostics.
